Question_1.Context: The study focused on the growth optimization of Chlorella sp. S5 under different conditions.
Question_1.Question: What was the specific growth rate of Chlorella sp. S5 during the study?
Question_1.Source: The specific growth rate of Chlorella sp. S5 was found to be 0.14 µ/day.

Question_2.Context: The study evaluated the lipid content of Chlorella sp. S5 for potential biofuel production.
Question_2.Question: What was the lipid content of Chlorella sp. S5 during the study?
Question_2.Source: The lipid content of Chlorella sp. S5 was found to be 16%.

Question_3.Context: The study investigated the volumetric lipid productivity of Chlorella sp. S5.
Question_3.Question: What was the volumetric lipid productivity of Chlorella sp. S5 during the study?
Question_3.Source: The volumetric lipid productivity of Chlorella sp. S5 was 46.4 mgL-1 day-1.

Question_4.Context: The study examined the reduction of nitrates and phosphates from agricultural runoff using Chlorella sp. S5.
Question_4.Question: What percentage reduction of nitrates was achieved by Chlorella sp. S5 in agricultural runoff treatment?
Question_4.Source: Chlorella sp. S5 achieved a 95% reduction in nitrates from agricultural runoff.

Question_5.Context: The study analyzed the reduction of phosphates in agricultural runoff by Chlorella sp. S5.
Question_5.Question: What percentage reduction of phosphates was achieved by Chlorella sp. S5 in agricultural runoff treatment?
Question_5.Source: Chlorella sp. S5 achieved a 91% reduction in phosphates from agricultural runoff.

Question_6.Context: The study investigated the biodiesel production process using B. subtilis Q4 MZ841642.
Question_6.Question: What was the total FAME content of the biodiesel produced?
Question_6.Source: The GC–MS analysis showed that the total FAME content of biodiesel produced was 98%.

Question_7.Context: The study evaluated the FAME composition of the algal biodiesel produced.
Question_7.Question: Which fatty acid methyl ester had the highest percentage in the algal biodiesel?
Question_7.Source: The FAME content of algal biodiesel was highest for methyl palmitate at 32.1%.

Question_8.Context: The study examined the anaerobic digestion of oil-free algal biomass for biogas production.
Question_8.Question: What was the biomethane yield obtained from the lipid-extracted algal biomass?
Question_8.Source: The biomethane yield obtained from lipid-extracted biomass was 364.34 NmL/g VSadded.

Question_9.Context: The study investigated the anaerobic digestion process using different substrates.
Question_9.Question: What was the biogas yield obtained from the whole biomass of Chlorella sp. S5?
Question_9.Source: The biogas yield obtained from whole biomass was 330.34 NmL/g VSadded.

Question_10.Context: The study evaluated the growth of B. subtilis Q4 under varying concentrations of methanol.
Question_10.Question: At which methanol concentration did B. subtilis Q4 show the highest growth?
Question_10.Source: B. subtilis Q4 showed high growth at 10% methanol at all the incubation points.
